description:
This place is called Cafe Med now, but the idea is still the same.

You can get Mediterranean food or burgers at the counter, or you can load up a box at the salad bar. The shawarma is good, but they don't give you a lot of meat in each wrap. The salad bar is an absolute steal though - I've loaded up on leafy greens, fried fish, tikka masala, and a bunch of other things for less than $10 (they weigh it by the pound).

Best part is that there is never a long wait. This is the best kept secret in the Financial District.
author: Casey S.

description:
Great place to get greasy hangover food lol
Or grab salads by weight with some sides 
They do have discounts after 2pm
author: Naby S.

description:
I used to know this place as Lightening Foods before, and continue to come here with its new name La Nouvelle. This is hands down my favourite food joint in San Francisco. I work a few blocks away and come here almost 2-3 times a week. They have a buffet bar which has a great selection of hot and cold foods and is paid for by weight - this is great as sometimes you are not too hungry and  you only want to have a little bit for maybe 4-5 dollars :) They have some items which are available every day and the rest keep changing every day to keep things different. The food is just spectacular for the price you are paying. 

Additionally they have menu of items that you can request to be made fresh on the spot. This includes burgers, shawarmas, wraps, etc. The food from their fixed menu is also brilliant, especially the bacon cheese burger.

And lastly, this place is Halal, so you have a great variety of food to eat which is otherwise difficult to find in the Financial District. If you haven't tried this place yet, you're missing out! It's fantastic :)
author: Arif F.

description: I took a walk for lunch today because it can get really stuffy at the WeWork office. I stumbled upon this and had to go in! Minimum for credit card was $5. The salad bar is amazing and so affordable! The salad bar has a lot of other non-salad items like butter chicken, grilled chicken, and okra! I spent $5.75 and feel really full! I am so glad I found this place! Super recommend for budget-friendly eats in the Financial District.
author: Charlene F.

description:
Wow, I did not realize that in 6 months this place has been open it has received only two reviews. Weird.

I stopped by for lunch, couple of blocks away from my office, and ordered the turkey wrap.  It was delicious.  I especially liked the fact that they toast the wrap like a panini, it still has the shape of a wrap, but the tortilla is a little toasty and ever so slighlty crunchy under the teeth. Yum!

Ingredients were super fresh, and the salad that came with - a surprise - was excellent.

Another FiDi lunch choice for the hungry downtown crowd. Go here.
author: Massimo M.

description: I used to know this place as Lightning foods and it was pretty great place back when and still is now. I usually get the chicken wrap and its pretty fire and theres nothing that really changed other than they no longer serve pasta. The chef in the back is still the same and he knows his stuff. Definitely recommend this place as they have a food bar as well if that floats your boat.
author: Navdeep D.

description: Another place that I am sad to see closed. Used to go here often when I worked closeby. Really good sandwiches, shawarma and fries. Service was a little rough but the food make up for it. Used to sit outside in the shade and people watch. Used to sit outside in the shade at lunch chilly
author: Sunil R.

description:
Lightening Foods has morphed again https://www.yelp.com/biz/lightening-foods-san-francisco-4

So, far with the exception of the French Pastries, it seems to be the same foods

Rather than the buffett, I tend to go for their freshly prepared Middle Eastern plates.
author: Roy C.

description: This place is NOT closed! I just got my lunch from there TODAY (under the Cafe Med name). It's the first thing I've ever had from there, and it was a MealPal lunch: Roasted fish over rice. It was... OK. Not bad, not great (one of my pieces of fish was oddly grey... I didn't eat that piece). I would certainly try it again. They seemed to be getting a good amount of business when I was in there. Will try a different dish next time.
author: Eric H.

description:
New patisserie in the FiDi. A French pastry chef making amazing croissants (plain, chocolate and almond), pastries and bread. Best croissants I've had in SF, reminds me of France, the pastry is not that oversized, blown up dried out puff pastry that every other patisserie is using, this is the real deal. 

Definitely my new go to for breakfast deliciousness.
author: Jim O.

description:
I went to this place through MealPal. The food picture that was on Meal Pal was different from what I received.
The chicken was dry, hard to eat.
The rice was cold.
I understand the food they give is cheaper, but at least keep the quality so next time I come to this place.
author: Melody J.

description: This is a roomy cafeteria with many seatings and a self serve bar priced by weight. I had moroccan chicken, which is soft and tasty with the spices, but I generally don't care for the type of rice and it's no different here. Since they have variety in their dishes, I'd be interested to come back and try more, but won't go out of my way to do it.
author: Liz H.

description: The staff for some reason was extremely rude. I'm a very happy go lucky person. I speak to everyone with a smile when I enter a room. I spoke to both of the young ladies at the front, they barely cracked a fake smile and neglected to say Hello. And when I went to pick up my food at the back counter, the man servicing that area was extremely rude. I wouldn't recommend going to this place. They are not very inviting or welcoming at all. Not only was the customer service bad, the food was dry. I ordered the special they had via MealPal called Empress Chicken. Shit was gross. The rice was super dry, I literally choked and the chicken was not seasoned at all. I couldn't taste anything that the description had in it. Terrible food and service. I don't know if it is cause of the way i look or the color of my skin but they sucked!
author: Melonee H.

description: I remember going here and trying the bacon burger. It's my favorite thing about this place. It's a must try burger
author: Jared D.

description: Has a decent selection of food for take-out. Their indian food is decent, and if you meet a certain price point, they'll give you a free drink.
author: Brian N.

description:
After 5 straight hours of dead-end research, I was hungrier than a member of the Donner Party.  I wanted to switch up my routine today, so I decided to try a "hot new business" near my office.  

It was a little after 2 p.m. by the time I left, which is the perfect time to take a lunch break in SF proper, if you can wait that long.  

When I walked in to CM, no one was in there.  Score!  I'm not a lunchtime misanthrope or anything, but I like to move the process along (time being money, and all). 

Even though today (May 28) was National Burger Day, I opted for the Spicy Chicken Caesar Salad.  I note, however, that there are many good looking, healthy options on their menu.  And I hear their salad bar is bitchin.  Your options are listed on a large black chalkboard located above the sandwich/salad line.  I ordered my salad with light dressing and no croutons.  Next time I think I will order the dressing on the side, since "light" is subjective.  The cook made my salad in a flash, and it was topped with a copious amount of chicken as well (see my pic)--could have made 2 meals out of it, I reckon.  While the cook made my salad, the cashier waved me over to pay my check.  Multi-tasking: I'm a fan.  Saves time.

The salad was really yummy--I didn't read the menu closely but I'm pretty sure the "spicy" chicken was, in fact, jerk chicken, one of my faves.  I also like when the chicken on the salad is warm.  

But you know what was really great?  The salad was only $8.95--smokin' banana peels!  That's a great price for the Financial District, or really anywhere in SF for that matter.  Score again!  The best.  

This is a great place for lunch... not sure how busy it is during normal lunch hours, but I definitely recommend.  Give it a whirl.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Oh yeah, I knew that sign looked familiar. I went to Cafe Med several times during the nanosecond it was on 2nd Street near Market where Mehfil is now. I just liked the option of having roasted vegetables and couscous for lunch when I was feeling the pudge over my belt. I had since changed jobs and office locations, but the pudge is still there. And now Cafe Med is back replacing the perpetually dismal Cafe Vivoli on the corner of Pine and Battery (one of my very few one-star reviews: http://www.yelp.com/biz/cafe-vivoli-san-francisco#hrid:GBUj4yQ3jTvjwug-nbgQ2A). It's a more expansive operation than it was at that weird two-floor set-up on 2nd with a salad and sandwich counter and a full buffet bar of hot and room temperature food.

I've tried both options, and my verdict is that it's pretty good, nothing that outstanding but perfectly serviceable for a relatively fast FiDi lunch. As others have pointed out, the buffet line is strikingly similar to the one across the street at Chez Fayala, which I frankly think is a good thing since I like the variety of selections (see photo). The food quality here is not quite as good, a bit more cafeteria-level, but that may have more to do with the newness of the place and the cooking staff here. While you wait for them to get their groove on, you may want to try the $7.95 Spicy Chicken Caesar (see photo), which I thought was pretty decent especially if you're looking for a lot of poultry. It was a bit dry but nothing that the dressing couldn't address. I'll be back.

FOOD - 3 stars...pretty good start for their new space, still looking for them to find their groove
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...definitely a bigger, more updated space though that huge buffet table is awkwardly placed in the middle
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...serviceable
TOTAL - 3 stars...good initial promise for a nearby lunch option
author: Ed U.

description:
I really hate this place. I work right next door so I've stopped in a couple of times, but this is the last.

First of all, their vents blow out air all day, causing you to smell like their restaurant just by passing by. Our entire office lobby smells like their vents, it's disgusting.

Secondly, I always feel like I get ripped off by this place. They have a $5 minimum for credit card purchases, but you end up spending $8 on a scoop of rice and fish anyway, so don't worry.

Chez Fayala is way better across the street.
author: Angela L.

description: They closed for three weeks for remodeling but they will open today.  However it looks like they changed their name to Lightening Foods.  Those who work near Rincon will remember that one.  Not sure if this is the same owner.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Stopped in here for a quick bite and I must say I was surprised at how much I liked it! The variety of foods and quality of the dishes made it a very pleasant dining experience for me. I stopped in after 2pm so I got a huge plate of food for only $6...was pretty crazy. I really enjoyed the chicken tikka masala, falafel, and fried fish the best. There was also a really flavorful cauliflower salad they had that day. Obviously it's hard to recommend just one thing since it's a rotating salad and hot food bar...but it seems to me this is a great place if you need something to eat and are in a hurry.

The restaurant itself is a good size with lots of room near the food bars, and there's plenty of seating. It's in the financial district so parking is non existent unless you want to pay $20 for a $6 meal.
author: Vy B.

description: I love this place because they offer discounts. Even if the discount is only after 2 and most of the food is gone, I still appreciate it. The financial district is really expensive and caters to high powered investment bankers, financial advisors, engineers etc. The financial district restaurants forget that secretaries , receptionists and the bottom of the corporate food chain also work there. So when I see a deal....I am on it like yogurt on rice. What? You don't put yogurt on rice! ...it's delicious!
author: Julianna I.

description:
Indian/Mediterrean lunch buffet.  Around $7-8 per lb.
When I'm craving Indian and want a variety of stuff for takeout, I'll go here.

THe chicken curry rice is good.  The chicken less dry than other dishes
Chicken tikka masala - chicken a little on the dry side but the sauce is ok
The pea/eggplant dish - super yummy.  my fave
okra dish - didn't like this,  the okra had a slight slimy feel
spinach paneer - ok..a little on the more bitter side but I didn't mind it
naan - decent
meatball - super dry.  blech
cucumber salad - flavorless
various salads - just ok

I also tried their falafel made to order...it's the first time I actually saw someone grill the wrap with the wax paper on.  What the hell?  The grill marks are on the wax paper instead of the wrap.  And the inside is not warm.  MAJOR PASS on this one.  Oasis Grill or any of the mediterrean cafes on Kearny are way better.  But the lunch buffet is decent.
author: C A.

description:
With plates big enough to serve a family,  I think I found my lunch spot to feed my Tikki Masala cravings. I Love it. Didn't order any of the dinner plates and went with the buffet style lunch. Great options and the food was just as good. Their chicken curry lacked taste but they made for it with their Tikki Masala. Prices were surprisingly reasonable. I walked out paying a little less than $8 for my plate of food.  Three things I would get again when I come back would be; 
Tikki Masala- hard to mess up.
Spinach Roll/pie? 
 Fried Fish. Cooked just right with the right combination of seasoning. I can eat this by itself or with rice. Thinking about it I would even throw this in a sandwich.
author: JJ S.

description:
CAFE FAYALA vs. CAFE MED

There seems to be a little rivalry between these two eateries which are across the street from each other. I have been going to Cafe Fayala all the time but I wanted to give this place a chance. I went here yesterday for lunch. I thought about getting a sandwich but to compare the two I decided to get the buffet. I tried to get similar items here as in Cafe Fayala: beet salad, fried fish, and rotisserie chicken. My first take was not impressive at all. I would call a draw of the beet salad in both places as it is tasty in both places, but that is where the comparison ends. The fish here is not as tasty as the fried sea bass at Cafe Fayala. The worst part was the rotisserie chicken as it was dry and flakey. Since the chicken was so dry I ended up swallowing little pieces of bone. In fact one piece is still stuck in my throat. Let me just say I don't need to come here again to make a comparison between Cafe Fayala and Cafe Med. I know where my loyalties lie.
author: Gerald R.

description: Great falafel wrap! It's my favorite item to order and they lightly toast the outside of the wrap, a bit like a panini without compressing the wrap too much. The dish comes with a light and refreshing salad. I've also eaten at the buffet table which has a variety of delicious Mediterranean foods and curries as well. I have to restrain myself from overeating! The chefs and cashiers are friendly enough. Actually friendlier than a lot of similar eateries downtown SF. There is seating both indoors and outdoors. The prices are very reasonable and they give a good amount of food when you order off the menu. I haven't tried the half price at 2:00pm yet but I see long lines of people getting food at that time.  Best of all, Cafe Med is really close to my office.
author: Lucy L.

description:
Cafe Med is great for a quick grab 'n' go lunch in fidi or if you want to sit down in the restaurant and have a nice conversation. TIP: Don't sit inside on a hot day - it is like an oven in there, but thankfully they have some outdoor seating as well! 

I've only tried their buffet but it has a huge variety of cuisines and food. Salads, Mediterranean, Indian, Chinese, Italian - what more could you want? 

Be careful what you fill up your box with in the beginning because there are a lot of good options down the buffet line as well. (All the meat dishes are at the end) 

This is probably my favorite buffet place I've tried so far in the city!
author: Malika R.

description:
Salad bar - falafel, chicken tikki masla, basmati rice, Moroccan chicken, grilled fish. Hummus, spinach.

All that for under $10.  Not bad for that much variety for a work day lunch.  Seating outside is nice, though very loud on the busy street.
author: Denise M.

description:
YAY, Cafe Med opened up again!

After mysteriously closing (well, I only say that because I had no idea why they'd closed their old location on 2nd St.) awhile back, Sara P. and I were suuuuper stoked to discover that it would be re-opening in the old Cafe Vivoli spot in the Financial District.  Perfect - this place is right between our offices.  It was just meant to be.

I've never been to the restaurant that previously occupied this spot, but I could tell they re-did the insides so the restaurant looks brand spanking new, and it's bright and airy.  There is a salad bar with hot food (much like Chez Fayala and Lee's), and there is a place for you to order sandwiches and salads.  We opted for the salad bar, which is a little less than $7/lb, meaning it's a LOT cheaper than its other FiDi counterparts.

Food was fresh, but the selection isn't HUGE or anything - nonetheless, I was able to try pretty much everything AND stay under $9 for my entire meal.

YUM: roasted chicken, baked fish, cucumber-tomato-feta salad, string beans, vegetarian couscous, tofu with bell peppers

PASS: "Shanghai" noodles.  This tasted like a soy sauce mess.  I'd rather go to Panda Express and get their chow mein.

There's plenty of seating, and as we ate (we arrived right around noon), the place started filling up.  Suggestion for the owners/managers: have trash cans more readily available; for some reason after eating, we didn't see any near the entrance/exit, so we ended up throwing out our containers and utensils in a trash can on the street.

So glad we have a new lunch spot in the neighborhood.  Welcome back, Cafe Med!
author: Tori S.

description:
Not sure why I only gave 3 stars before, this place is great. I think I underestimated how much I love getting salad so cheap yet fresh, such delicious pasta options, plus plenty of different meats to devour. 

Went last week and just went again today and it was very good. No lines, lots of fresh bread, hummus, and salad, and at only $4.95, it's a winner for lunch with leftovers for dinner.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I have been to Cafe Med a few times. A lot of folks say that Cafe Med is similar to Chez Fayal but I disagree. Cafe Med has numerous varieties of Indian dishes on buffet while Chez Fayala have none.

I go to this place to have their Indian food as other dishes are not that great. Tried their falafel which was below average, spinach pie too was below average, other side offerings (garlic baked potatoes, sauteed asparagus, etc) are below average.

A bit pricey compared to similar places around. Priced /lb

Must Try: Okra curry is delicious. Their chick pea curry is also great and goes perfect with naan bread.
author: Jay M.

description:
In the FiDi, there aren't many restaurants, but cafes.  These cafes are "buy food and sit down to eat it" with very limited amounts of seating available.  Cafe Med actually is one of the bigger cafes in this area with lots of ample seating inside.  Although I came here with the intention of getting the lamb burger, I left here confused and more likely to try the salad bar on a future visit.

The interior is spacious with tall ceilings and windows all around.  The salad bar is smack dab in the middle of the room with different Mediterranean choices that can be plucked for a reasonable $6.75 per pound price.  A few feet away sat the made-to-order window for sandwiches, entree salads, entree meals, pasta, and of course burgers.  I ordered the lamb burger on foccacia bread which came with feta cheese, roasted peppers, caramelized onions, and mint aioli spread.   Fries came with the meal.  After I ordered, I thought that I was second in line to receive my order.  I observed the kitchen staff frantically prepping food to replenish the salad bar and what I thought would only take 10 minutes to get my food, ended up being 20.  I had my suspicions that they didn't have any lamb prepped that day which would explain the delay.

Eventually I did get my food and after a few bites, I discovered that the meat didn't have any seasoning although the meat was certainly fresh tasting.  The remaining condiments did help to jazz up the taste but ultimately, I was disappointed.  I have yet to try a good lamb burger that can equal or top the Park Chow in the Sunset's version.  

Although this is just one experience at this cafe, I did notice that their staff were hard-working and diligent in getting that salad bar stocked for hungry customers who wanted to grab and go with their food.  Thus, if I felt inclined to return, I would most likely line up and get in and out a lot quicker than if I custom ordered my food.
author: Ben H L.

description: Great place to have lunch. It has salad bar which has middle eastern delicacies. Price is very affordable. I will recommend to everyone!!!
author: Moazzam K.

description:
Cafe Med is A-Ok, solid three star eatery. My lunch date and I duck into this locale at 1145am, and thankfully we did because if we met for lunch at our usual times at 1230 we would not have a seat.

Is it a salad bar? Is it a traditional
sit down restaurant? It's both and neither. The salad bar looked nice enough - lettuce with the fixin's and pasta salads and chicken tiki masala? I wasn't in the mood for that and truth be told we were already primed to order a shawarma...what with the photos on the colorful sandwich board. 

So you order, they write up a ticket for you and you go to another line to pay. After you pay, you wait again, trying to not confuse folks that you're in line to order, for your food to be plated or boxed. Have someone wait for the food and another scout a table. Too much waiting around otherwise. Hmmm...This place reminds me of New York. 

But I've digressed. I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken shawarma. The chicken was almost like a filling to the pita wrap, a med burrito if you will. I appreciated how it was crafted neatly, helped me scarf it down, i mean enjoy each bite. The marinated chicken was good. The sauce it yielded was good. The pickles, tomatoes and lettuce were good. Garlicky sauce that somewhat present was good. I needed heat and thankfully they delivered a chili sauce that matched and complimented the other flavors.

Tasty food, good sized portion and friendly staff is what warrants the three star rating. Maybe would receive an extra star if ordering off the menu didn't mean a waiting ordeal and as my dining companion suggested had better drink options or better yet a soda fountain.
author: Marie B.

description:
Fresh, delicious, reasonable prices. Can't beat that. Ohhh yeaaa...the staff are very hospitable. 
Definitely my new fave lunch spot!! :))))))
author: Mitch L.

description:
Hated this place! 
Their fish was literally raw and tasteless. Chicken was full of thyme that you cannot even taste the chicken itself. I ended throwing up! Their Indian section is no good either. Bland and loaded with curry powder.
In addition, it's just too pricey for a normal sized meal! - Can't even think about stepping in again!!
author: Hirra M.

description:
Cafe Med-iocre

Aside from being a comedic genius, I am also quite the food buffet connoisseur. I have tried the buffet at Cafe Med a number of times with the hopes that it will improve, but recently I decided the food at the buffet will always be lukewarm and bland.. 2 stars for the buffet.

The wraps and burgers, on the other hand, are great. Cooked to order and well-seasoned, I stop here sometimes when I am in a rush and need a decent meal at a fair price. But if there's a long line, I usually head elsewhere.. 4 stars on the rest.

Additionally, since I took a math class in college, I can average these two meals to land at a solid 3-star rating for this Cafe on the corner. No hard feelings, bro, a 3/5 in this city means you're doing better than most.
author: Richard J.

description:
It was my first time there, I was in a hurry (trying to make it back to my desk before anyone realized i was gone). I grabbed a to go box and filled it with samples of some of my favorites: falafel, hummus, chicken curry, chicken masala, the noodle salad, the fried fish, and some naan. 
Priced at 6.99/Lbs. Yes...
I rushed back to my desk and inhaled the entire contents of the box and still had time to write a review.
author: Karla g.

description:
We came here for lunch a few weeks back to try something new. Mediterranean and Greek cuisine, this is a quick and easy place to pick up lunch if you're in the FiDi area. The seating area is large and there's a buffet where you can serve yourself from (with the cost of your meal based on weight) as well as a grill and hot food area where they make sandwiches, burgers and a few other things at request. 

I personally found it to be rather intimidating due to the busyness, size and options, so I wound up at the grill and ordered a falafel pita for myself and a chicken pita for a coworker at the office. Two of my other coworkers went through the buffet and were seated and eating long before I was able to get my two pita wraps out. 

The food is good and I enjoyed my wrap. The buffet had some options that looked good and both my coworkers really enjoyed their choices. Getting seating was a bit difficult for three of us as it was really packed, but we were able to find a spot and cleared out as soon as we were done.

Not bad of a place for lunch, although service is a bit slow at the grill area in my opinion. Worth checking out if you're a fan of Mediterranean and buffets!
author: Cassandra J.

description: I came here for lunch with a friend and this place is insanely packed around lunch time. At Cafe Med, you have two options to get your food: you can grab food from the food bar (priced by the pound) or you can order at the back counter. I did the latter, and while that meant I didn't have to go through the massive line of more than 30 people, I still ended up waiting a long time for my lamb wrap to be made. The lamb wrap was nothing spectacular, but for around $8, I got what I expected. Overall, the wrap was a little bland (definitely ask for hot sauce if you want a bit more flavor) and could have been warmed up more on the panini press. Would I come back here again? Yes, but definitely not my first choice. If you're willing to walk a few blocks down, there's a Halal truck on Fremont and Market that I think is much better.
author: Austin W.

description:
There are many places to go to in the FIDI for lunch. The selection is almost limitless. But like most of us who work here we don't always have the time to pick and choose. We barely leave our desks and when we do we haven't had enough time to give thought to where we want to go. A few years ago these quick salad and hot food buffets started to turn up on every corner. These were great alternatives to your typical sit and order establishments because you could pick and choose what you wanted and basically serve yourself. Essentially they solved the dilemma for us of having to pick and choose and wait for food.

The prior establishment here...cafe Vivoli was such a place. It was a great place because they had so much selection. I was upset when they closed up shop. Then came Cafe Med. I was reluctant to try it at first but once I did I was again hooked.

Cafe Med still has the pasta made to order station. They still do pizza and calzones. They still do the salad bar and the hot food bar. They kept all the great things about Vivoli and improved on it. The hot bar has more selection. The pasta is just as great as it was before. The prices are still very reasonable. The only thing they took away was being able to pay the price of your container and fill it up. Now everything is weighed and you don't have the option.

That's ok though. Here you get convenience and quality and for that the extra $$ (not too much - I've got mouths to feed) is just fine.

The hot bar is a fine offering of Mediterranean food. Be careful as you will get more than what you came for and you will go over a pound easily without self-control. I'm speaking on behalf of people I've seen eat there of course. I, myself, have perfect self-control and will power.
author: Ryan C.

description: The food is great here.  The space is clean and the line moves fast.  Great spot for lunch.  Also catering is wonderful here too, highly recommended.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Chicken fight.

Peter won: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W4WGQmWcrbs

Kebab won: Delicious chunks of chicken wrapped up in an oversized pita with lettuce, tomatoes and hummus instead of tzatziki. Side of veggies too. Almost $10 with tax.

Earlier competition including a salad bar with Empress Chicken (second place with a rich flavor) and Moroccan Chicken (last place with all the oil).

Plan to spend about $8 when paired with other salad bar options like roasted potatoes, spinach, Brussels sprouts, hummus and pita.

Wrap almost earns a fourth star but prices keeps things at three.

It was a close fight.
author: Jason B.

description: Went here a few times to avoid the lines at Chez Fayala and thought it wasn't bad.  Today however,  had a piece of their fish from the self serve bar and it was raw!!!  Looks like the intent wasn't too serve it that way either.  They seasoned the fish, dunked it in sauce, and served it.   Last time I'm coming here!
author: Tommy V.

description: This is another new restaurant I went this past week. They had a decent buffet with middle eastern and Indian. The place is large, so it was nice to be able to find seating and didn't have to yell at each other. I picked some cooked veggies, fish and rice and the food was decent.
author: Yoko S.

description:
OH MAN!!  i hit the jack pot yet again.  YET-AGAIN!

this place is awesome.

i had a mixed green salad with tomatoes, mushroom and shredded carrot with balsamic vinaigrette.  then they had this indian food section.  there was (all indian style) crunchy wiggly kind of rice noodles w/ some kind of leafy crunchy vegetable, celery and a sauce that was sesame or peanut, basmati rice, chick peas masala, okra with some kind of stewed tomato, spinach saag, spicy crispy chicken and bread.

you know how much i paid for all that?  THREE-DOLLARS and CHANGE!

ok, ok, it was after 2pm so it was half price but STILL!!  STILL!!!  and it was DE-LICIOUS!

the place is all roomy, light and airy.  the outdoor seating is very nice too.  it's a good lunch spot.  you'll definitely see me there pigging out again.
author: lori s.

description:
As many others say, very similar to Chez Fayala across the street, but...

- better spicy chicken sandwich (the unquestionable hit of the place)

And more importantly...

- much shorter lines.  Even if CF is marginally better, the drastically reduced wait makes a big difference at crazy lunch hour...
author: Jeremy T.

description: It's pretty hot inside because the grills are out in the open. Order your meal from the counter and get your appetizers from the salad bar. Once you order and load up on salad bar items, take your tickets to the counter to pay. Food was good, the falafel was the softest I've ever had.
author: Bianca R.

description:
This review is for their salad/buffet bar:

Pros: 
-good for a quick meal
-fresh ingredients
-clean

Cons:
-limited seating
-food is pretty tasteless
-food isn't warm

Tip:  The chicken tikka masala is probably their best food item!


I think there are better lunch options in FiDi but the food isn't that bad if you are hungry and short on time.
author: Juliana K.

description:
I work in the financial district and I go here every day. The owner is a real nice guy. 

The food is excellent!

I love the new decoration.

They save my life every day.

Really, you can't eat mediterrainian food this good, at this price anywhere around
author: Pablo M.

description:
Cafe Med is a good place to go if you need decent food fast.

What can I say, their buffet food is what you'd expect from a buffet: not much flavor and warm-ish. However, if you're in a pinch, it will do.

I recommend sticking with their sandwich menu if you have a little more time.

The salad bar is a good choice if you want an alternative to expensive salads from other places down the street.

They have a large seating area, which is great if you're meeting a friend for lunch. Service has been good, although it has been a tad disorganized once or twice. I haven't had to wait long when I ordered a sandwich.
author: Jason G.

description: Closed!! I went today after quite a while, looking forward to my usual fresh Med lunch. But they're totally closed down. No idea why! :-(
author: Mick J.

description:
Although I'm obsessed with the Spicy Chicken Salad at Chez Fayala, I'm actually super glad that they were slammed and one of my analysts mentioned this place.  I got the 1/2 chicken rotisserie with salad for $8.95 and asked the sweet man who plated my togo order for a side of their pesto that looked delish.  I also got a small side of the roasted brussels sprouts because I love them and if I see them, I must have them!  

I got back to the office with the small side, it was enough for two meals!  The chicken was so tender and juicy and had a great flavor.  I chopped some of it up and mixed it with my salad, and slathered some of the pesto sauce on it and I was in heaven.  On Mondays and Wednesdays this Summer, I have class, so it was great to only have to buy one meal for under $11.00 that fed me for two meals!  Take that Chez Fayala with your busy self!  ;)
author: Brandy B.

description: A very impressive salad bar ranging from tofu, beets, brown rice, chicken salad, Brussels sprouts, different types of lettuce.  Most importantly the quality is very good. Other than a salad bar, you have a few choices of hot meals and a whole list of sandwiches they prepare for you. This is a GOOD QUALITY meal for anyone in a rush, lunch break or a after the gym.
author: Delilah L.

description:
This place would have earned more stars from me if a better buffet/salad/sandwich place wasn't literally across the street. Both spots are right around the block from my office, they serve similar food, but one simply tastes a lot better than the other. 

The food at Cafe Med is bland, unfortunately. The warm food is not very warm.  The fried fish is soggy and flavorless. The buffet selections are very poorly labeled - I inadvertently had my first piece of steak in years as part of what I thought was a vegetarian cabbage salad :( To top it off, the prices are a bit high for the quality. 

I think I'll stick to Chez Fayala.
author: Anya P.

description:
Absolutely loved the food!
Had vegetables - green beans were wonderful and brussel sprouts were good, baked fish and fried fish - both great with the fried edging out the baked.

This was my first time - so review may change after more visits, hope not.
author: Gene R.

description:
I love this place! They offer so many options! Sandwiches, Mediterranean dishes, salads, pastas, etc... They even have rotisserie chickens! 
I definitely recommend Cafe Med for lunch or catering. The staff is nice, food is delicious and prices very reasonable.
author: Kais B.

description:
The Dish: I ordered the Spicy Chicken Salad. Though the chicken was not actually spicy, the salad was amazing. I personally love iceberg lettuce and the dressing was absolutely delicious. It is a little expensive ($8.75 with tax) for salad, but I would say it's an absolutely filling and delicious lunch. My friend got the Cob Salad, which was also delicious - very different than the Spicy Chicken Salad. 

The Ambience: Reminds me of Chez Fayala. Very clean and friendly. The employees there are also very nice. There's a nice buffet in the center if you don't want salad or sandwiches.
author: Gina T.

description: It's a direct ripoff of Chez Fayala. It's not bad, but nothing special, and CF does it all better.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Great little spot for lunch! The food is excellent and clearly prepared with care and attention to detail.  I had the lamb burger and a variety of salad from the bar. The salad bar pricing is far more reasonable than many places nearby, which is great if you can eat as much salad as I do! 

The staff are friendly and helpful, and management really knows what they are doing. This is my new go-to spot for lunch! See you there.
author: Ruby T.

description: You want bugger..This is the place to eat...the best bugger I have ever eaten...Place is clean and the staffs are very friendly..Will keep going there again and again..Can't get enough...If you in the area,Stop by and you will know what I am talking about...
author: Safeel M.

description:
Love this place. Such good food and at a very good price.
Love the falafel, rice, pastas, chicken curry , etc.
author: P D.

description:
Opted for the falafel sandwich which was quite good, but too oniony for me but no problem, they were easily picked out. 

Great, quick lunch in between meetings in the financial district.
author: Jay E.

description: Good.  Nothing mind-blowing, but it's a lot less of a zoo than nearby spots during prime time and the chicken ceasar had a real lot of chicken (similar to Chez Fayala).  I'll give the buffet or burger a try another time since it's a nice eating environment.
author: Marc S.

description: the food here is so awesome. My only concern is it will spoil me so I won't appreciate other food anymore.  The prices are surprising cheap for neighborhood too.
author: Patrick C.

description: Cafe Med is a popular lunch spot that is very similar to Chez Fayala. In terms of buffet food, I prefer the choices at Chez Fayala, but the sandwiches and salads seem to be comparable. I had the spicy chicken sandwich, which was served on a crispy ciabatta. The chicken wasn't spicy, and since I love my hot and spicy it was a little disappointing! However, the sandwich as a whole was pretty good, especially with the roasted red peppers. I'm beginning to become more judgmental about my sandwiches just because I've had such great ones, but this one is definitely worth a try!
author: Ashley T.

description: Wonderful food for sit-down or take out; I love the Mediterranean wrap with hummus.  A good value.  They also catered a light appetizer spread at at my office, and everyone (meat eaters and vegetarians) really enjoyed the food.  On time and perfect delivery!
author: Wendy L.

description: Had lunch here for the first time. I really liked the diversity of they offered. The food seemed very fresh and tasty. I'll go here again.
author: Damoon M.

description: Cafe Med is definitely my go-to place. I love the relaxing environment and the food is very satisfying.
author: Omran I.

description:
Terrible salad bar. Food tasteless and bland. Some of the chicken dishes had bad flavor. I ended up throwing away my food after several bites. 

Try again Cafe Med.
author: T L.

description: As a Equinox trainer at Pine St, the food isn't really that bad. I pretty much dead veggies and lean proteins. Actually I don't know if the proteins are really lean but you know it's good enough. There is one girl that works there that is this the cashier, she is super friendly.
author: Vinson H.

description: good food, the salad bar is a deal with 50% off after 2.  All the cheap-skates line up and hover around at 1:55 waiting for the clock, which can make it slow.  But if you are as cheap as them, come join the penny-watchers, they know a good deal.
author: April H.

description: The salad bar has great variety and you can order fresh made sandwiches, salads and shawermas! Great burger, they season them right on the spot. I walk an extra 3 blocks during lunch just to get the food. Would leave an extra star if I could!
author: Kay H.

description: A place I'll only go to for lunch after 2pm because they used to have a half-off buffet at that time (though now it's 25% off).  They are trying desperately to compete with Chez Fayala, which is a similar buffet across the street, but can't.  Their food isn't as fresh, the salad bar isn't as good, and the only thing they have going for them is that their entrees are ever so slightly better than those at Chez Fayala.  They are also very tacky in their approach to getting business from Chez Fayala - they once hired someone to hold up a sign by Chez Fayala stating how bad that restaurant is.  It wreaked of desperation.
author: Ryan S.

description: Fresh, yummy, reasonably priced lunch buffet.  They have a few vegetarian options. The food is NOT GREASY. Thank you, cafe Med! I will be back over and over again as long as I work in FiDi. Also, the buffet is half-price after 2 pm.
author: Irena P.

description: Came here after final straw at chez fayala (thanks for directing me here with your big sign saying cafe med stole your concept! Brilliant). Couldn't be happier - exceedingly friendly and helpful staff, clean fresh food, delicious and tasty. Many many vegan/vegetarian dishes - something for everyone. Welcome to the neighborhood, you've got yourself a new fan!
author: Christine B.

description:
Had high hopes for something with a bit more variety and less onions than Chez F across the street, and it was fairly good (although suspiciously curiously same things).
BUT, it appears to be full of MSG and SALT.  Wow, the MSG headache arrived within an hour and was impressive for having had so little food.  But, definintely there.
author: Trecker J.

description: I love stopping by Cafe Med over the lunch hour when I can't decide exactly what I want to eat. They always have a great variety and I leave very satisfied. Great pricing too.
author: Mike P.

description: Food is HALAL and very good! I like that they change the food selection all the time. Everything is very flavorful and filling. You can order sandwiches as well and they are pretty fast.
author: Sophia S.

description:
I have passed by cafe med numerous times and today i finally decided to give it a try after i heard good things about cafe from one of my co-workers.
There was a sald and hot bar (buffet style) and sandwiches can be ordered seperately.
They had salads , Pasta , noddles , fried veggies (with garlic?) , spicy potatoes , mediterranean chicken curry , tikka masala , naan.. and many others to choose from.
I tried chicken curry with naan and boy it tasted so good. Tikka masala was little bland for my taste buds. Their Falafal is soo crunchy and soft inside .
Spicy potatoes were soo sooo good. 

I loved the food and definitely go back  .
author: Sri S.

description:
How did I not know about this place till now.... I would give it a 4.5/5, but there was no option. This review is only for their LUNCH BUFFET

- Great spread/variety of food
- Amazing falafels, as good as it can get, crunchy outside, soft inside...
- considering its not an indian place, still they had flavourful indian option in the buffet
- good Salad bar
- not too pricey
- enough places to sit

It would be in my list of regular places from now..... i used to be a fan of chez's buffet, but this surely is better....
author: Piyush G.

description: Good salad bar with tones of options. Prices are based on per pound and 50% after 2pm. But in this visit, i ordered falafel sandwich with fries. Serving size was really good more than what one can eat for lunch. The menu says falafel sandwich but it is actually a wrap. I liked the taste of falafel was good but the rest of ingredients were not very fresh and the combination did not really go well, maybe because the ingredients were not fresh. I liked the fries and it was seasoned well but the falafel sandwich/wrap was a let down.
author: Ashok L.

description: I tried the lunch buffet so I could try a little of everything they had to offer. Their hummus and tabouleh as well as their naan bread are very good. Their dolmas were quite strange, all rice and too much bitter lemon juice. The piece of Moroccan chicken I got, that I thought was a breast, was actually a shoulder blade and neck...so all bones. Decent variety of vegetables and salad options. If I were to go again I would try a shwarma sandwich instead of the buffet. Their price for the buffet $6.75/lb may be fine if you are only getting a salad but if you want a more substantial meal I think getting a sandwich or burger would be a better choice.
author: C K.

description: Just like chez fayala but more fried stuff. Hummus is not good. Indian curry is also there.
author: Ashish S.

description: GROSS! if you like salt burgers than you might like this place but if your a normal human, don't eat here. The food is the same quality as Lee's Deli with the prices of a dining restaurant. This place is lame.
author: Penelope F.

description: Very good lunch experience.  Well worth the price.  The food was crispy and fresh.  Some of the best sandwhichs I've had around.  A good lunch experience.
author: Secret S.

description: If I was say, Mediterranean, i.e. Moroccan,  I think the hot salad bar items would be similar to eating my mother's home cooking, but I'm not, I'm German, and I love this place!! I particulary enjoy the Israeli couscous, and the potato dish as well as the spreads, pita, you name it.  They spice so well and the chicken tagine I had yesterday is worth returning for again today.  I can't believe some people think it's flavorless but you have to keep in mind that most of us sit all day for a living under fluorescent lights, breathing stale air, and are constantly running around catching colds; therefore our noses probably aren't working as good as they could be.  I think the price is very fair for our neighborhood and I will continue to support them as much as possible...after all, it could be a Chipotle....
author: Donna W.

description: This establishment definitely copies what Chez has to offer, but what you can't beat is the quality of the salad bar when its after 2 pm. Not only is it half off after 2 pm, the food quality is better than Chez. Overall, if you need something to eat after 2 pm this is the spot, otherwise go across the street and get the real deal.
author: Ryan C.

description: Dropped in for a quick lunch. I was surprised by the wide choices of items in the "salad bar". I had spinach, chicken masala with naan. Very good!
author: Kitty M.

description:
I stopped by the new Cafe Med and saw they redecorated the interior and it looks very nice! I was in a rush so I picked up a lamb burger to go and it was excellent!

Definitely going to come by again and try more things.
author: Neczar S.

description:
I went to Cafe Med. I have to admit, I am a fan of Chez Fayala. I went over to Cafe Med cause i had lunch at 2pm but didnt want to pay 5 dollars for a whole box of food,  because I wanst feeling hungry. So i got a little of everything at Cafe Med.(went in a 1:58pm). Not a lot of food left.. everything looked like leftovers from lunch earlier. I thought the fried fish was too oily.. it left huge stains on my container and overall was very oily. I also got a baked fish which seemed a little undercook.
REG Price: $6.75/pound
After 2pm: $3.38/pound

Overall. I was satisfied with my $2.70 lunch, but would have rather enjoyed a lunch at Chef Fayala. Their fried fish never disappoints!
author: Leila T.

description: Many times I walked past this place debating if i would eat there or not. So, today I ordered their sharma hoping for rice. Little did I know Id be getting a wrap. Even thought I was disappointed I had already paid. When I took my first bite, I was in awe. This food was great!
author: Raheela D.

description: On Fridays, their sea food soup is by far the best soup I've ever had in my life, please make it every day. :)
author: Junior C.

description: Great beef shwarma.... Certainly worth coming back and exploring the rest of the menu.
author: Rob W.

description: I typically order the fettuccine chicken alfredo dish.. sometimes it's good sometimes it can be a bit salty.inconsistency in the kitchen for this specific dish.  However, the variety of food is awesome.  Never bored to try something new. i'd def come back again and again for lunch.
author: Becky U.

description: Best buffet place you can eat in the city. Fresh ingredients fresh food and healthy as well. Everything is made fresh the same day. I would give this six stars if I can
author: Fernando M.

description: I love Cafe Med as an option for eating healthy on a budget. I eat at their salad bar almost every day. It's half-price after 2pm and has a great hot bar. I often find myself hungry and watching the clock as 2pm approaches. Sounds crazy, but I'm completely serious! (I'm a startup founder with very little time and money.)
author: Justin X.

description: Exorbitantly priced for left out buffet food! It is not very good overall, and expect to spend $16 on lunch. On the flip side it is way less sketchy than Lees!
author: Laurence S.

description: The food kinda makes up for the terrible service the older gentleman at the register gave.
author: Naomi A.

description: Chicken Shawarma wrap was pretty tasty. Came with a free salad and soup, all for $7.99. Short lines, but food does take pretty long to come out.
author: James A.

description:
This is one awesome place. Everything is fresh.. 
And if you want your blood to flow good to your heart and brain eat fresh veg. great 
salad bar.
author: Nirav V.

description: Stopped by today for the lunch buffet. Very good price and really good food. Will definitely be coming back for lunch breaks!
author: Mostafa E.

description: I primarily go to this restaurant when I want fish. The fried fish is good, but the roasted fish is better. Their rice is terrible so I never get that, but their scalloped potatoes are delish as is their cucumber salad. Otherwise, the selection is not that great for me as I'm not a fan of chicken or pasta. It's an ok place, especially after 2:00 when their prices go down to half off. Nice inside and outside seating. I'll have to try their burgers sometime as I'm always looking for a good burger place.
author: Reynolds L.

description: My husband and I both got the chicken shawarma today.  Not only did it take a long time to receive our food, but it tasted HORRIBLE!  A few bites and then straight to the garbage can.
author: Heather L.

description: They have a salad bar and a burger bar with open seating in a not very well ventilated space so it gets very hot and very smokey very quick.  The first time I went here about a month ago, I ordered a cheese burger and as soon as I did, I saw the chef but two patties on the huge grill that you can see.  After watching him make up the burgers (10 minutes has passed by now, almost half my lunch break), I thought certainly one was going to be mine but instead he hands the burgers to a guy who was sitting at a table with his date.  The cashier saw this and gave the chef a nasty look.  I asked when will my burger be ready he said a few more minutes.  It took another 10 minutes.  The burger was tasty, but constricted poorly and fell apart in my hand.  I had to use a fork to finish it.  The second and probably last time I went here was today and I ordered, quelle surprise, a cheese burger.  This time it only took 6 minutes, but not until I got to my desk did I realize he gave me a chicken burger.  I don't know why I keep finding places with the worst customer service ever.
author: James F.

description: Favorite place to eat in the FiDi area. Good selection and good food and 50% off after 2PM which is awesome! Would recommend for people who work in the area, especially if you are taking to go or in a rush.
author: Nick S.

description: I chanced by this place due to a carpool drop off anomaly, and was very happy to discover a place that makes delicious breakfast wraps, after many a disappointing breakfast wrap in the vicinity. Affordable, delicious, high quality ingredients, and made with obvious care and attention to detail. I noticed they have a lamb burger and will definitely be back for lunch.
author: Sandra S.

description: The real question is which side of the street do you want to eat on for fairly similar food, Cafe Med or Chez Fayala? For me, it's not even close: go Chez Fayala, especially if you want a sandwich or a salad bar. In fact, even though Fayala is more crowded (for good reason) they don't really have the service thing down yet at Cafe Med, so you get through Chez Fayala just as quickly.
author: Jeff L.

description: came here for the first time last friday and i had a really good experience! went for the buffet, and stuffed myself silly for only $9! food is 50% off after 2pm which is a big plus, meaning all that yummy food i ate would have only been $4.5! definitely going back here again soon.
author: Claudine C.

description: One of the best, quick lunch spots in the financial district. I struggle to find anything good in this area that isn't a sit down restaurant. They have a counter where you can order a sandwich, or you can hit the salad bar, which also has fish, chicken, veggies, etc. I would highly recommend this if you just want to grab something good for lunch.
author: Sam T.

description: Comparable to Chez Fayala without being over-crowded.  All the food I've tried has been pretty good.
author: Molly C.

description: Awesome variety of Indian and Mediterranean food, nice people and a great location. Plus, you can order wraps and burgers off the side menu. Food is charged by the weight of food on your plate, great lunch prices for the Financial District.
author: C T.

description:
my favorite by far is the med burger...juicy, tasty, so yummy. 

I tried the salad bar too...lots of delicious options and always fresh.
author: Zack J.

description: i am eating a delicious spicy chicken sandwich right now, they made it lovingly, lots of steps, melting, toasting - nice side salad -- can't ask for anything more
author: Matis A.

description: A friend recommended cafe med to me. Had lunch there today! It was amazing. The falafel is a must try! The wait staff was awesome and super friendly. If you are looking for a great place to stop in for lunch I'd highly recommend it I only wish they were open for dinner as well
author: Adam M.

description: I have been going here since it opened up early this year! It so happened I was in search if having something delicious and as I passed by this little gem, I smelled something grilling with a perfect blend of spices... Out of curiosity I stepped in and saw 3 people eagerly waiting for something. I was not sure and I asked one of them, they said oh we are waiting for burgers... I then looked at their menu and  was delighted to see they had Lamb Burgers (something that cafes usually dont have!)... I then ordered one for me and it came with delicious thick cut fries - crispy on the outside and soft inside with perfectly seasoned blend. I went in the next day and tried their buffet. I loved the variety of food, especially the salad bar and baked fish.... Their rotisserie chicken is really very flavorful and moist... this is truly a real gem with perfect location, perfect food, lot of choices, plenty of seating and how can someone beat the lamb burgers! :)
author: Gayatri S.

description: the shawarma is...adequate. the salad bar selection is pretty crazy big.
author: T R B.
